page.title: 13Bright Steels (continued)
page.content:
It was soon after the First World War that Mr Chouler, the founder of the company, decided over a game of dominoes in a Norton-on-Derwent public house to set up a small steel works in the town.
At that time, production of steel "flats" was in its infancy and Mr Chouler struggled to survive. It was not long, however, before his enterprise gained reward and he was dealing with some of the largest firms in the engineering trade.
Bright Steels' success and subsequent expansion of business has meant that more production space has had to be created. Large extensions have, therefore, been built on the company's present four acre site at Beverley Road, Norton-on-Derwent.
